00036 #include <fastrig.h>
00037 
00038 REAL phasemod( REAL angle )
00039 {
00040     while ( angle >= TWOPI )
00041         angle -= ( REAL ) TWOPI;
00042     while ( angle < 0.0 )
00043         angle += ( REAL ) TWOPI;
00044     return angle;
00045 }
00046 
00047 //REAL phasemod(REAL angle)
00048 //{

00052 #if (TRIG_SPEED != 0)

00063 #define TAN_MAP_RES     0.003921569 /* (smallest non-zero value in table) */
00064 #define RAD_PER_DEG     0.017453293
00065 #define TAN_MAP_SIZE    256

00135 
00136 void InitSPEEDTRIG( void )
00137 {
00138     int i,
00139         SIZE;
00140 
00141     TABLE_FACTOR = ONE_OVER_TWOPI * SIN_TABLE_SIZE;
00142     SIZE = sizeof( REAL ) * ( SIN_TABLE_SIZE + 1 );
00143     sinT =
00144         ( REAL * ) safealloc( SIZE + ( SIZE >> 2 ) + 1, 1, "InitSPEEDTRIG" );
00145     for ( i = 0; i < SIN_TABLE_SIZE + ( SIN_TABLE_SIZE >> 2 ) + 1; i++ )
00146         sinT[i] = sin( ( REAL ) i * TWOPI / ( REAL ) SIN_TABLE_SIZE );
00147     cosT = sinT + ( SIN_TABLE_SIZE >> 2 );
00148 }
00149 
00150 REAL fast_sin( REAL x )
00151 {
00152 #if (TRIG_SPEED==2)
00153     x = ( x * TABLE_FACTOR ) + 0.5;
00154     return sinT[( ( int ) x ) & ( SIN_TABLE_SIZE_M1 )];
00155 #else
00156     int i,
00157         ip1;
00158     REAL frac;
00159 
00160     x = ( x * TABLE_FACTOR );
00161     i = ( int ) ( frac = floor( x ) );
00162     ip1 = i + 1;
00163     frac = x - frac;
00164     return ( 1.0 - frac ) * sinT[i] + frac * sinT[ip1];
00165 #endif /*  */
00166 }
00167 
00168 REAL fast_cos( REAL x )
00169 {
00170 #if (TRIG_SPEED==2)
00171     x = ( x * TABLE_FACTOR ) + 0.5;
00172     return cosT[( ( int ) x ) & ( SIN_TABLE_SIZE - 1 )];
00173 #else
00174     int i,
00175         ip1;
00176     REAL frac;
00177 
00178     x = ( x * TABLE_FACTOR );
00179     i = ( int ) ( frac = floor( x ) );
00180     ip1 = i + 1;
00181     frac = x - frac;
00182     return ( 1.0 - frac ) * cosT[i] + frac * cosT[ip1];
00183 #endif /*  */
00184 }
00185 
00186 /*****************************************************************************
00187  Function:      Arc tangent
00188 
00189  Syntax:        angle = fast_atan2(y, x);
00190                     REAL   y       y component of input vector
00191                     REAL   x       x component of input vector
00192                     REAL   angle   angle of vector (x, y) in radians
00193               
00194  Description:   This function calculates the angle of the vector (x,y) based
00195                 on a table lookup and linear interpolation. The table uses
00196                 a 256 point table covering -45 to +45 degrees and uses
00197                 symetry to determine the final angle value in the range of
00198                 -180 to 180 degrees. Note that this function uses the small
00199                 angle approximation for values close to zero. This routine
00200                 calculates the arc tangent with an average  error of
00201                 +/- 0.045 degrees.
00202 *****************************************************************************/
00203 
00204 REAL fast_atan2( REAL y, REAL x )
00205 {
00206     REAL x_abs,
00207          y_abs,
00208          z;
00209     REAL alpha,
00210          angle,
00211          base_angle;
00212     int index;
00213 
00214     /* don't divide by zero! */
00215     if ( ( y == 0.0 ) && ( x == 0.0 ) )
00216         angle = 0.0;
00217     else
00218     {
00219         /* normalize to +/- 45 degree range */
00220         y_abs = fabs( y );
00221         x_abs = fabs( x );
00222         //z = (y_abs < x_abs ? y_abs / x_abs : x_abs / y_abs);
00223         if ( y_abs < x_abs )
00224             z = y_abs / x_abs;
00225         else
00226             z = x_abs / y_abs;
00227         /* when ratio approaches the table resolution, the angle is */
00228         /*      best approximated with the argument itself...       */
00229         if ( z < TAN_MAP_RES )
00230             base_angle = z;
00231         else
00232         {
00233             /* find index and interpolation value */
00234             alpha = z * ( REAL ) TAN_MAP_SIZE - .5;
00235             index = ( int ) alpha;
00236             alpha -= ( REAL ) index;
00237             /* determine base angle based on quadrant and */
00238             /* add or subtract table value from base angle based on quadrant */
00239             base_angle = fast_atan_table[index];
00240             base_angle +=
00241                 ( fast_atan_table[index + 1] -
00242                   fast_atan_table[index] ) * alpha;
00243         }
00244 
00245         if ( x_abs > y_abs )
00246         {                       /* -45 -> 45 or 135 -> 225 */
00247             if ( x >= 0.0 )
00248             {                   /* -45 -> 45 */
00249                 if ( y >= 0.0 )
00250                     angle = base_angle; /* 0 -> 45, angle OK */
00251                 else
00252                     angle = -base_angle;    /* -45 -> 0, angle = -angle */
00253             }
00254             else
00255             {                   /* 135 -> 180 or 180 -> -135 */
00256                 angle = 3.14159265358979323846;
00257                 if ( y >= 0.0 )
00258                     angle -= base_angle;    /* 135 -> 180, angle = 180 - angle */
00259                 else
00260                     angle = base_angle - angle; /* 180 -> -135, angle = angle - 180 */
00261             }
00262         }
00263         else
00264         {                       /* 45 -> 135 or -135 -> -45 */
00265             if ( y >= 0.0 )
00266             {                   /* 45 -> 135 */
00267                 angle = 1.57079632679489661923;
00268                 if ( x >= 0.0 )
00269                     angle -= base_angle;    /* 45 -> 90, angle = 90 - angle */
00270                 else
00271                     angle += base_angle;    /* 90 -> 135, angle = 90 + angle */
00272             }
00273             else
00274             {                   /* -135 -> -45 */
00275                 angle = -1.57079632679489661923;
00276                 if ( x >= 0.0 )
00277                     angle += base_angle;    /* -90 -> -45, angle = -90 + angle */
00278                 else
00279                     angle -= base_angle;    /* -135 -> -90, angle = -90 - angle */
00280             }
00281         }
00282     }
00283 #ifdef ZERO_TO_TWOPI
00284     if ( angle < 0 )
00285         return ( angle + TWOPI );
00286     else
00287         return ( angle );
00288 #else
00289     return ( angle );
00290 #endif /*  */
00291 }
00292 
00293 #endif /*  */
